org.eso.ias.kafkautils

Class SimpleStringConsumer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eso.ias.kafkautils.SimpleStringConsumer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SimpleStringConsumer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    /** Generic Kafka consumer to get strings from a kafka topic.

    The string are passed to the listener for further processing.

    Kafka properties are fully customizable by calling setUp(Properties): defaults values are used for the missing properties.

    Life cycle: setUp() or setUp(Properties) must be called to initialize the object; tearDown() must be called when finished using the object; startGettingEvents(StartPosition, KafkaConsumerListener) must be called to start polling events from the kafka topic startGettingEvents(StartPosition, KafkaConsumerListener) returns when the consumer has been assigned to at least one partition. There are situations when the partitions assigned to the consumer can be revoked and reassigned like for example when another consumer subscribe or disconnect as the assignment of consumers to partitions is left to kafka in this version.

    Author:
    acaproni

      • startGettingEvents

        public void startGettingEvents(SimpleStringConsumer.StartPosition startReadingFrom,
                               SimpleStringConsumer.KafkaConsumerListener listener)
                        throws KafkaUtilsException
        Start polling events from the kafka channel.

        This method starts the thread that polls the kafka topic and returns after the consumer has been assigned to at least one partition.

        Parameters:
        startReadingFrom - Starting position in the kafka partition
        listener - The listener of events published in the topic
        Throws:
        KafkaUtilsException - in case of timeout subscribing to the kafkatopic
